name: Hampton Inn & Suites Coeur d'Alene

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I enjoyed our week-long stay. The hotel was right on the Centennial Trail, so we could walk to just about everywhere we went. The staff was very friendly and kept the place spotless. We only had two complaints. First, we felt the staff could have been more accommodating of our request for a room with a balcony, especially since it was the primary reason we selected the property. Unfortunately, they appeared more interested in attracting new guests rather than accommodate existing ones. Second, the rooms could use more comfortable seating. We had one straight-back dining room chair and one swivel desk chair. Okay for a business traveler, but not very comfortable for a week-long home away from home.
reviews.title: Great location, well maintained and very clean, but...

reviews.text: It was definitely one of the better "chain" hotels we have stayed at, but left us longing for the "vacation resort" feel some of the other properties offered.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: Great service. Very nice rooms comfortabe beds. Breakfast is ok. We have stayed here several times. Only major issue is hotel is not pet friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: We were very impressed with this hotel. It is new, has comfortable beds, pool and hot tub open 24 hours, cookies upon arrival between 4 and 6 and the breakfast included is the best anywhere I stayed. It has 2 waffle makers (which taste good), 2 hot items daily, fruit salad (the real fruit), cereal, milk, coffee, yogurt, muffins, toast, bagels, english muffins, etc..., hot chocolate, juice and more. The seating area is comfortable and spacious and clean. It is located in the newer area of town with some stores and restaurants close by. One thing to keep in mind is there are no safes in the room. A suggestion for the hotel to add. They do have a few safes in the lobby if you ask to use but not ideal. We enjoyed our stay that we wanted stay longer but the hotel was booked. I know why. Definitely a place we will be going back to. Tip: If you are going to Silverwood you can buy your tickets at Costco and save $5.00 per person.
reviews.title: Clean & Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did get on the lake for an afternoon which was beautiful. There is a beach near the downtown area next to a resort hotel, which by the way is more money and not worth it in my opinion. We had a great time in Coeur D'Alene and will be going back to stay at the Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: THE place to stay in Coeur d'Alene!

reviews.text: This is a very new property and it is very nice. The location is very close to downtown Coeur D'Alene and it is near shopping, a big new movie theater, restaurants etc. The location is very quiet (not near any highways) and the rooms are comfortable and nicely appointed. We had a King Suite with a separate shower. The room was very spacious with a nice balcony and large bathroom. There is a fridge, microwave, hairdryer etc. The lobby and the dining area is warm and welcoming. There is also a very nice gym and indoor pool area.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel
Our "Go-to-Place" when in Coeur d'Alene
reviews.text: We have stayed here a few times and have never been disappointed. Super clean, modern decor and great location for walking the trail and visiting Starbucks. Breakfast is the usual pastry and cereal but it has a nice pool and friendly service. Tip: Ask about view rooms as our king suite on the 2nd floor had a view of the roof instead of the park out back. The suite was laid out well and was quite large. No view was ok as we only stayed one night and left early the next day.

We stayed at the Hampton Inn Coeur D'Alene for 2 nights. Great location, boomtown type area, new restaurants, mall. Short drive to Lake. Room was very clean, modern, spacious. Nice size balcony, panoramic view. Service was good. Buffet breakfast was weakest link, not sure if hotel
reviews.title: Newer Hampton great rooms

reviews.text: can keep up with demand for huge mounds of food from some guests.
reviews.title: Try to get a balcony room
Awesome Hotel
reviews.text: Highly recommend this hotel.
We stayed here on our way to Yellowstone and it is very clean and new with lots of fancy touches.
reviews.title: Fantastic new hotel

reviews.text: Granite counters everywhere, high ceilings and a great hot, full breakfast.
reviews.title: We'll be back for sure!

reviews.text: We would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Very welcoming

reviews.text: Only complaint was that the hot tub and pool had a LOT of chlorine and we could not sit in the hot tub as the chlorine was soooo strong our eyes stung and were red the next morning. The large pool was a touch cold as well but my 7 yr old didn't really notice:)
reviews.title: Nice new hotel, convenient location, good value for money.

reviews.text: This was our first time staying in Coeur D'Alene and we loved it here. This hotel was perfect. We arrived before it was check in time and although they were unable to give us our room early, the front desk girl checked us in minus giving us the keys and gave me a map of the area and a rundown of all the activities in the area. This map came in very handy during our stay.
reviews.title: Once again trip advisor was right in!

reviews.text: I recently returned from a trip to Couer d' Alene. My son and I were touring the area for him to make a final decision about attending school in Idaho. The Hampton was our home away from home while we were there. I booked on Expedia and wasn't offered a room choice. I was able to call the hotel and have them confirm a room with two queen beds directly, in spite of having not booked directly with Hampton. They even left me a voice mail while we were flying to confirm the availability of our room preference. The hotel was immaculate. Breakfast satisfying. The property located near (but not too close) to major roads. It's also within walking distance of the water and a new shopping center with a movie theatre and restaurants. We're heading back to Idaho over the holidays to visit and ski and we'll definitely rebook at this property.
reviews.title: Great location - EXCELLENT customer service!

reviews.text: Our family has traveled quite a bit and always liked Hamptons. This one is the best! Admittedly, new, but all-around nice. We stayed in a 5th floor room. I don't know if every floor was this way, but not only a spacious room with all amenities, but higher ceiling giving an even larger feel.
reviews.title: Best Hampton ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All Hamptons have a certain menu at their breakfasts, but this surpassed them. Not just three types of cereal, but six. Two waffle makers instead of one. Wonderful eating area. Just everything a little nicer.
reviews.title: A top-notch Hampton Inn

reviews.text: Our kids liked the pool and late hours of operation.
reviews.title: Comfort and beauty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We bought Silverwood tickets here. They said the same price as Costco.
reviews.title: New hotel and much cheaper than famous hotel

aka: Hampton Inn And Suites Coeur d`Alene
